headline: Easy Homemade Shrimp Fried Rice
description: Skip ordering takeout and prepare this homemade shrimp fried rice easily in under 30 minutes in one pot, sure to please the whole family!
name: Easy Homemade Shrimp Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 cloves garlic, finely minced, or more to taste
3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce, or more to taste
0.5 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat sesame oil and olive oil in a large nonstick skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 3 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Remove shrimp from the skillet using a slotted spoon, allowing oils and cooking juices to remain in the skillet. Place shrimp on a plate and set aside.

Add peas and carrots and corn to the skillet and cook, stirring intermittently, until vegetables begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Push vegetables to the side of the skillet, pour eggs into the other side, and cook to scramble, stirring as necessary, 3 to 4 minutes.
Stir shrimp, rice, and green onions into the skillet. Drizzle evenly with soy sauce, season with salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Cook until shrimp is reheated through, about 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The Recipe was really good and fast and easy something that you can whip up real fast. I will definitely be using this recipe again
Was very good, but definitely need more soy sauce. I added probably a T of freshly grated ginger and more garlic. Could have had more ginger for sure.

Want to get your kids to eat the whole thing? Add a half can or 8 oz of pineapple tidbits. This simple fried rice recipe is easy to build upon. I make this when I need to use up leftover rice, veggies, or chicken breast from the fridge. Separating each set of ingredients as you cook is best. I add Tajin citrus pepper after cooking rather than black pepper during. I sometimes add saut√©ed chopped cabbage with a white onion. In lieu of sesame oil, I‚Äôll dump a teaspoon of sesame seeds in with the shrimp. I often pour a few ounces of hot water on top of the rice as I mix to prevent sticking. Pictured with hoisin sauce and Yum Yum sauce.
Super simple. I used frozen mixed vegetables.
This was delicious. We had some leftover pork so substituted shrimp for pork. We will definitely make it again and again!
Hands down this is the best recipe loved all of it my kids are picky eaters and they loved it ü•∞

This is so easy to fix and with just a few adjustments it is perfect. Too many recipes end up being dry, but this one is not. I did add a little more olive oil and sesame oil, and I reduced the rice to 2 cups. A touch of paprika and it taste just like what I have gotten from take out.

I tested this with canned veggies and it still turned out good. Had to throw them in at the end obviously but it was ok even with this. Can't wait to try it with frozen veggies. I made a half batch and it's still fed four people!
Very good. Followed the recipe
Came out to perfection!!!
The recipes was as the directions. I did not change anything.

I made it almost exactly as the recipe called for. It was good but it lacked the taste of the fried rice I get in the Chinese restaurant. I heard that there are 2 different types of soy sauce, usually used together. Perhaps I should try that method, or maybe I did something wrong?
No changes. It was quick & delicious üòã
Delicious, very easy. Didn't change a thing. Will be making this again!
This recipe is amazing. I didn't add peas and carrots. I also used white onions which I love. I'm a seafood lover so I doubled the shrimp ????????. Great recipe.

I followed the recipe exactly despite it being my first time making it! I added a bit more rice to it but I cooked the shrimp a bit longer but still delicious enough. So everything was going well till I needed to add a teaspoon and a half of soy sauce and a bit more garlic. That still left things bland so I decided to be experimental and took a dive into my herbs and spices. Throwing together with paprika, basil, and crushed red pepper and omg it turned out amazing! Especially if you enjoy things with a bit of kick to it, you definitely have to try this out and all I changed was some spices! Everything else was fantastic and added onions to it since I love them!
This is an excellent recipe. I did add Old Bay when frying the shrimp. Added frozen peas and carrots (did not have corn). Everything came out perfectly, and my family enjoyed it.

This was awesome. I followed the recipe exactly except I didn't have corn, so added more peas and carrots. Very easy as long as you have all the ingredients prepped before you start cooking. This one is a keeper. I added a little oyster sauce after cooking, but that's just my personal preference. It was great with and without it.

Prepared the recipe mostly as is. I reduced the recipe to 2 servings and still had leftovers! So beware this recipe yields a lot if you are a person who eats small portions! Instead of using corn, I replaced that for the same amount of peas and carrots and chopped a small onion I had lying around. This was very good and as long as you "mise en place" (prep all before starting) you should have a meal in a matter of minutes! Don't fret if you do not have a fancy wok as long as you have your reliable non-stick pan that you know, you should be fine. Don't overcook your shrimp would be my most important advice for this recipe. I will make this again!
I tried this for the very first time and loved it.

Made this for the family last night and it was a hit! I'm pretty picky with how I like my shrimp, so I wasn't sure if I would like it in a stir fry (fried or scampi is usually my go to). But even I couldn't help but go back for seconds. Delicious and simple. I did swap out regular onion for the green and accidentally put in 3 garlic gloves instead of two.....ooops, but I'm pretty sure that even my changes didn't make much of a "flavor" difference. It is great!

I didn't have any corn so I just used frozen peas and carrots, and I didn't have sesame oil so I just replaced it with more olive oil. I also made a larger portion.
It still turned out well! I am a beginner cook and this was both easy and delicious!
I fried my own carrots but this was very yummy
Delicious. Big hit with my children. The whole family loved it.

Yummy!!! I followed the recipe except for adding a little more low sodium soy sauce. I over cooked the rice, so be attentive not to allow this to happen. I prepared the dish in a wok pan and I believe this added ease in the preparation. I recommend this recipe and I will make this dish again.

Simple and delicious. I used a bag of cut up peas and carrots I had in the freezer--they worked just fine. I probably used more canola oil than I was supposed to, but it wasn't greasy so that worked. I've made fried rice a bunch of times and couldn't find any of the recipes I already tried, but I don't care. I'm going to use this one from now on!
Used a bag of frozen oriental veggies instead of the peas/carrots/corn. Pre-peeled shrimp makes it even faster. Also used brown rice. It was easy and delicious.
It‚Äôs become a ‚Äúkeeper‚Äù in my family. Shared it with in-laws and they are now fans too. Didn‚Äôt modify the recipe but did add a little soy sauce to my plate afterwards.
